paragraphs.content: Chapter 38
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 38

paragraphs.content: Then the LORD answered Job out of the whirlwind, and said,
paragraphs.contentHtml: Then the Lord answered Job out of the whirlwind, and said,

paragraphs.content: Who is this that darkeneth counsel by words without knowledge?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Who is this that darkeneth counsel by words without knowledge?

paragraphs.content: Gird up now thy loins like a man; for I will demand of thee, and answer thou me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Gird up now thy loins like a man; for I will demand of thee, and answer thou me.

paragraphs.content: Where wast thou when I laid the foundations of the earth? declare, if thou hast understanding.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Where wast thou when I laid the foundations of the earth? declare, if thou hast understanding.

paragraphs.content: Who hath laid the measures thereof, if thou knowest? or who hath stretched the line upon it?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Who hath laid the measures thereof, if thou knowest? or who hath stretched the line upon it?

paragraphs.content: Whereupon are the foundations thereof fastened? or who laid the corner stone thereof;
paragraphs.contentHtml: Whereupon are the foundations thereof fastened? or who laid the corner stone thereof;

paragraphs.content: When the morning stars sang together, and all the sons of God shouted for joy?
paragraphs.contentHtml: When the morning stars sang together, and all the sons of God shouted for joy?

paragraphs.content: Or who shut up the sea with doors, when it brake forth, as if it had issued out of the womb?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Or who shut up the sea with doors, when it brake forth, as if it had issued out of the womb?

paragraphs.content: When I made the cloud the garment thereof, and thick darkness a swaddlingband for it,
paragraphs.contentHtml: When I made the cloud the garment thereof, and thick darkness a swaddlingband for it,

paragraphs.content: And brake up for it my decreed place, and set bars and doors,
paragraphs.contentHtml: And brake up for it my decreed place, and set bars and doors,

paragraphs.content: And said, Hitherto shalt thou come, but no further: and here shall thy proud waves be stayed?
paragraphs.contentHtml: And said, Hitherto shalt thou come, but no further: and here shall thy proud waves be stayed?

paragraphs.content: Hast thou commanded the morning since thy days; and caused the dayspring to know his place;
paragraphs.contentHtml: Hast thou commanded the morning since thy days; and caused the dayspring to know his place;

paragraphs.content: That it might take hold of the ends of the earth, that the wicked might be shaken out of it?
paragraphs.contentHtml: That it might take hold of the ends of the earth, that the wicked might be shaken out of it?

paragraphs.content: It is turned as clay to the seal; and they stand as a garment.
paragraphs.contentHtml: It is turned as clay to the seal; and they stand as a garment.

paragraphs.content: And from the wicked their light is withholden, and the high arm shall be broken.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And from the wicked their light is withholden, and the high arm shall be broken.

paragraphs.content: Hast thou entered into the springs of the sea? or hast thou walked in the search of the depth?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Hast thou entered into the springs of the sea? or hast thou walked in the search of the depth?

paragraphs.content: Have the gates of death been opened unto thee? or hast thou seen the doors of the shadow of death?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Have the gates of death been opened unto thee? or hast thou seen the doors of the shadow of death?

paragraphs.content: Hast thou perceived the breadth of the earth? declare if thou knowest it all.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Hast thou perceived the breadth of the earth? declare if thou knowest it all.

paragraphs.content: Where is the way where light dwelleth? and as for darkness, where is the place thereof,
paragraphs.contentHtml: Where is the way where light dwelleth? and as for darkness, where is the place thereof,

paragraphs.content: That thou shouldest take it to the bound thereof, and that thou shouldest know the paths to the house thereof?
paragraphs.contentHtml: That thou shouldest take it to the bound thereof, and that thou shouldest know the paths to the house thereof?

paragraphs.content: Knowest thou it, because thou wast then born? or because the number of thy days is great?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Knowest thou it, because thou wast then born? or because the number of thy days is great?

paragraphs.content: Hast thou entered into the treasures of the snow? or hast thou seen the treasures of the hail,
paragraphs.contentHtml: Hast thou entered into the treasures of the snow? or hast thou seen the treasures of the hail,

paragraphs.content: Which I have reserved against the time of trouble, against the day of battle and war?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Which I have reserved against the time of trouble, against the day of battle and war?

paragraphs.content: By what way is the light parted, which scattereth the east wind upon the earth?
paragraphs.contentHtml: By what way is the light parted, which scattereth the east wind upon the earth?

paragraphs.content: Who hath divided a watercourse for the overflowing of waters, or a way for the lightning of thunder;
paragraphs.contentHtml: Who hath divided a watercourse for the overflowing of waters, or a way for the lightning of thunder;

paragraphs.content: To cause it to rain on the earth, where no man is; on the wilderness, wherein there is no man;
paragraphs.contentHtml: To cause it to rain on the earth, where no man is; on the wilderness, wherein there is no man;

paragraphs.content: To satisfy the desolate and waste ground; and to cause the bud of the tender herb to spring forth?
paragraphs.contentHtml: To satisfy the desolate and waste ground; and to cause the bud of the tender herb to spring forth?

paragraphs.content: Hath the rain a father? or who hath begotten the drops of dew?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Hath the rain a father? or who hath begotten the drops of dew?

paragraphs.content: Out of whose womb came the ice? and the hoary frost of heaven, who hath gendered it?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Out of whose womb came the ice? and the hoary frost of heaven, who hath gendered it?

paragraphs.content: The waters are hid as with a stone, and the face of the deep is frozen.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The waters are hid as with a stone, and the face of the deep is frozen.

paragraphs.content: Canst thou bind the sweet influences of Pleiades, or loose the bands of Orion?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Canst thou bind the sweet influences of Pleiades, or loose the bands of Orion?

paragraphs.content: Canst thou bring forth Mazzaroth in his season? or canst thou guide Arcturus with his sons?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Canst thou bring forth Mazzaroth in his season? or canst thou guide Arcturus with his sons?

paragraphs.content: Knowest thou the ordinances of heaven? canst thou set the dominion thereof in the earth?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Knowest thou the ordinances of heaven? canst thou set the dominion thereof in the earth?

paragraphs.content: Canst thou lift up thy voice to the clouds, that abundance of waters may cover thee?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Canst thou lift up thy voice to the clouds, that abundance of waters may cover thee?

paragraphs.content: Canst thou send lightnings, that they may go, and say unto thee, Here we are?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Canst thou send lightnings, that they may go, and say unto thee, Here we are?

paragraphs.content: Who hath put wisdom in the inward parts? or who hath given understanding to the heart?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Who hath put wisdom in the inward parts? or who hath given understanding to the heart?

paragraphs.content: Who can number the clouds in wisdom? or who can stay the bottles of heaven,
paragraphs.contentHtml: Who can number the clouds in wisdom? or who can stay the bottles of heaven,

paragraphs.content: When the dust groweth into hardness, and the clods cleave fast together?
paragraphs.contentHtml: When the dust groweth into hardness, and the clods cleave fast together?

paragraphs.content: Wilt thou hunt the prey for the lion? or fill the appetite of the young lions,
paragraphs.contentHtml: Wilt thou hunt the prey for the lion? or fill the appetite of the young lions,

paragraphs.content: When they couch in their dens, and abide in the covert to lie in wait?
paragraphs.contentHtml: When they couch in their dens, and abide in the covert to lie in wait?

paragraphs.content: Who provideth for the raven his food? when his young ones cry unto God, they wander for lack of meat.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Who provideth for the raven his food? when his young ones cry unto God, they wander for lack of meat.
